questions.question: What does a red traffic light mean?
options: Go if no cars are coming
questions.explanation: A red light always means stop.

questions.question: What should you do when you see a yellow traffic light?
options: Speed up to beat the red light
Stop if it is safe to do so
questions.correctAnswer: Stop if it is safe to do so
questions.explanation: Yellow means the light is about to change to red. If it's safe, you should stop.

questions.question: What does a green traffic light mean?
options: Go if no pedestrians are crossing
questions.explanation: Green means you can go if the way is clear.

questions.question: What does a flashing red light mean?
options: Stop and proceed when it's safe
Stop and wait for green light
questions.correctAnswer: Stop and proceed when it's safe
questions.explanation: A flashing red light means you should stop and then proceed when it's safe.

questions.question: What does a stop sign indicate?
options: You must make a full stop
Slow down and prepare to stop
Stop only if other cars are coming
questions.correctAnswer: You must make a full stop
questions.explanation: Stop signs require a full stop at the marked line.

questions.question: What does a yield sign indicate?
options: Slow down and prepare to stop
Give right of way to others
questions.correctAnswer: Give right of way to others
questions.explanation: A yield sign means you should give way to other traffic.

questions.question: What does a No U-Turn sign indicate?
options: You can make a U-turn if no other cars are coming
U-turns are allowed at all times
You must not make a U-turn
U-turns are allowed during certain hours
questions.correctAnswer: You must not make a U-turn
questions.explanation: A No U-Turn sign means U-turns are prohibited.

questions.question: What does a Do Not Enter sign indicate?
options: Enter only if you are going the speed limit
Do not enter the road or highway
Enter only if no other cars are coming
questions.correctAnswer: Do not enter the road or highway
questions.explanation: A Do Not Enter sign means you should not proceed into the area.

questions.question: What does a Speed Limit sign indicate?
questions.explanation: A Speed Limit sign indicates the maximum legal speed allowed.

questions.question: What does a pedestrian crossing sign look like?
questions.explanation: A pedestrian crossing sign shows a person walking.

questions.question: Who has the right-of-way at an intersection with no traffic signs or signals?
options: The vehicle that is going straight
questions.explanation: At an intersection without signs or signals, the vehicle on the right has the right-of-way.

questions.question: Who has the right-of-way when a vehicle is entering a roundabout?
options: The vehicle that is in the roundabout
The vehicle that is entering the roundabout
questions.correctAnswer: The vehicle that is in the roundabout
questions.explanation: Vehicles already in the roundabout have the right-of-way.

questions.question: Who has the right-of-way at an intersection with stop signs at all corners?
options: The vehicle that is going straight
questions.explanation: At a four-way stop, the vehicle that arrived first has the right-of-way.

questions.question: Who has the right-of-way when two vehicles reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time?
options: The vehicle that is going straight
questions.explanation: At an uncontrolled intersection, the vehicle on the right has the right-of-way.

questions.question: Who has the right-of-way when a pedestrian is crossing with the light at a crosswalk?
options: The vehicle that is going straight
questions.explanation: Pedestrians crossing with the light at a crosswalk have the right-of-way.

questions.question: What is the maximum speed limit on an urban interstate in Kansas?
questions.explanation: In Kansas, the maximum speed limit on an urban interstate is 75 mph.

questions.question: What is the maximum speed limit in a school zone in Kansas?
questions.explanation: In Kansas, the maximum speed limit in a school zone is 20 mph.

questions.question: When should you use your headlights?
options: From sunset to sunrise and when visibility is poor
questions.correctAnswer: From sunset to sunrise and when visibility is poor
questions.explanation: In Kansas, you must use your headlights from sunset to sunrise and when visibility is poor.

questions.question: When can you park in front of a public driveway?
options: If you will be gone for less than 15 minutes
If the driveway is not in use
questions.explanation: It's illegal to park in front of a public or private driveway.

questions.question: What should you do if you start to skid on a wet road?
options: Steer in the direction you want to go
Take your foot off the gas and do not try to steer
questions.correctAnswer: Steer in the direction you want to go
questions.explanation: If you start to skid, you should steer in the direction you want to go and avoid slamming on the brakes.
